description:
Title:

Software Engineering Intern

Around here, we define the future.

We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking several interns to work with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Cloud, DevSecOps, and Autonomous Systems techniques.

Must be a U.S. Citizen

Internship dates: April 12th (tentative) - August 13th,2021

For each of the projects, interns will leverage the AWS machine learning tools, continue to advance KBR's knowledge and application of data analytics. Interns will collaborate with scientific and engineering staff supporting projects such as the development of a Cloud Security Strategy to leverage the built-in capabilities provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). AWS tools used will include CloudWatch,Inspector, Systems Manager, GuardDuty, Kibana, and QuickSight, with opportunities for the addition of custom tools for configuration management, training, and other elements to complete a robust Cloud-based security framework forKBR.The frameworkwill include an end-to-end DevSecOps platform designed to automate security requirements by embedding security controls and processes early in the DevOps workflow, and will help our customers continue to develop and apply new technology capabilities while retaining systems security.

Additional projects will include investigating the value of Digital Twin (DT) in autonomous systems use cases; investigate setting up for the use cases and how the operational AI systems would interact with DT requirements. Explore methodology to address operational decision making utilizing machine learning in Air Traffic Management and other domains. Analyze textual information in transportation datasets to identify commonalities; demonstrate Natural Language Processing (NLP) capability. Managing telematics data, implement ability to overlay multiple vehicle routes on a map to assess road utilization.

Other projects will be similar to last year's summer internship program which consisted of: Reinforcement learning technique to enableautonomous systemsand robotics. Research Explainable AI and leveraging this technology to detect bias in machine learning models. Use distributed ledger/block-chain technology to enable governance and management of flight identifiers. Edge computing utilizing neuromorphic processing. Research and development of Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) software and hardware tools; develop an AR/VR solution to simulate real-world environments and facilitate activities such as remote maintenance of complex systems and virtual training environments.

Interns will spend the majority of their time researching, installing, and configuring new tools, programming using the selected tools, and learning more efficient methods to solve a given problem. Interns are not required to be programming experts, but they should have a passion for learning new things and not be afraid to jump in and try out new tools and/or solutions.

Interns will leverage an Agile Development process with daily scrum meetings facilitated using Jira to capture user stories and track the status of all issues. Fridays are reserved for documenting the work each week in the form of a Wiki site, as well as numerous forms of documentation (PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc.). Once a month, interns will present the work they have completed to other staff members atKBR, with a final presentation at the end of the summer to both KBR and customer personnel.

Required Education:

  • Must be enrolled in undergraduate coursework in a related degree program at an accredited university

  • Must be a Rising Junior or Senior

Preferred:

  • Basic familiarity with virtual environments and cloud-based technologies, as well as programming languages such as Java, Python, Perl etc.

Work Schedule: Estimated at 32-40 hours/week with flexibility to accommodate intern's education

Work Location: Telework

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Do you want to join a team that helps people protect the things that matter the most to them? Are you interested in discovering how to apply the skills you’re learning in school to solve real-world challenges? Are you looking for a well-rounded experience that enables and encourages continuous learning and participation in corporate social responsibility initiatives?

This internship is designed for current students and soon to be college graduates to gain a well-rounded introduction to and experience in Information Technology.  The internship will focus on principles of Agile Application Development & Software Engineering and will equip you with transferrable skills that can help you anywhere you go.

The program is a paid internship where you will be engaged in immersive learning experiences, from Dojos to tech talks, with the opportunity to showcase your work with our leadership.

We offer flexible schedules and an immersive remote environment. We’ll also be on the look-out for individuals who might be a good fit to join us full-time after graduation. We’ll share more throughout the program.

What you’ll get to do:

  • Plan, Develop, Implement and/or Support applications in various languages and disciplines including:
    • C#
    • .NET
    • JavaScript
    • HTML
    • CSS
  • Creative problem solving
  • Object oriented programming
  • Learning new technologies in the web application space
  • Research, solve for, and engage others as necessary to develop solutions that will result in the desired business outcome 
  • Web/mobile development & integrated systems
  • Handle application development tasks from program flow design, coding, devops, testing, implementation rollout
  • Ability to work and think independently to produce working code
  • Work through and resolve production issues for applications supported by the department or functional area
  • Prepare documentation on work produced to ensure a smooth handoff to other developers, as needed 
     

You bring your experience, knowledge & skills:

  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn
  • Project or Teamwork
  • Presentations & Tech challenges
  • Creative problem solver
  • Ability to demonstrate logical thinking
  • Community Involvement

Education:

Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Development, Information Systems, or a related program at an accredited university.

Job Description:

Software Engineering Intern

When you're part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you'll do important work. You'll have the opportunity to grow and learn in a culture that empowers your development. We have created an inclusive, global environment that values the power of diverse talent, backgrounds, and experiences to drive speed, productivity, innovation, and growth.

Our internship program will give you a chance to get real world business experience and build your network before graduation. We are seeking an energetic, responsible intern to join our growing organization. In this position, you will be expected to learn the ins-and-outs of our daily routines and procedures. You will focus on learning how our organization runs, and can be expected to gain valuable insight that can further your interest in your chosen career field.

Customers throughout the globe rely on our extensive range of products and services-from next-generation instruments to everyday lab essentials to life-saving medicine. If you desire to be a part of a world-class team, Thermo Fisher Scientific can provide you with the opportunity to work in R&D to produce products that enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Thermo Fisher's Research and Development work is carried out by dedicated, team-oriented professionals who want to make a difference.

Summary of Internship

  • Software testing
  • Development of Product Inspection or Web Gauging software products
  • Assist with algorithm research by gathering machine data and quantifying and summarizing the results
  • Work with the development team to understand the new features being created to then create test plans for those new features and execute them.
  • Conduct system (combined software / electronic / mechanical) prototype verification testing.
  • Possible automated test software development
  • Possible software feature development

Qualifications:


Interns can be responsible for testing data records, notebooks and computerized data storage. Additionally Interns are asked to make detailed observations and analyze data to ensure we are operating within expected parameters

  • Student currently enrolled in classes leading to an accredited Bachelor's/Masters degree in a related engineering, science or life science discipline
    • Preferred majors: Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other related major

  • C/C++/C# language experience preferred. Python language would be helpful. Java language could be applicable, if agreeable to learning the first languages listed.

  • Software being developed is primarily for "machines", not web, not business, not databases.

  • Strong desire and motivation to develop a career in Research & Development
  • Strong leadership and team building skills
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
  • Willingness to learn, be mentored, and improve
  • Desire to contribute and improve design of new and existing scientific instrumentation products
  • Exceptional customer focus
  • Desire to teach other engineers and scientist about technology in area of expertise
  • Requires a functional knowledge of laboratory equipment and techniques.
  • Accuracy and attention to detail is required in performing all functions of this position.
  • Initiative, organizational and computer skills are extremely valuable to ensure effective laboratory operations.
  • Excellent written and oral communications skills are required.
  • To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status

At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission-enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Apply today!


Position Title: Software Engineering Intern
Country / State - City: US - Minnesota - Minneapolis
Job Category: Internship & Apprenticeship
Thermo Fisher Scientific: is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Job Description

Cognex will be coming to the MSOE campus this fall to interview students for internships. In order to be considered, both a resume and transcripts must be attached to this job posting when applying.

Availability: Part Time (10-15 hours weekly) 2020-2021 school year, Full-Time summer 2021

Qualifications: Currently enrolled in or completed Freshman year of undergrad

Degrees: Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science

Skills: C# skill a plus.

Positions (3): Summer internships will join our Milwaukee engineering teams working on various software development projects, software test projects, or dev-ops infrastructure projects. Assignments will be based on individual skill sets, areas of interest, and areas of need that Cognex has. Demonstrated skill and passion for software development may lead to more complex development assignments over the course of the internship. All positions will be evaluated at the end of the summer to determine student and Cognex interest in continuing the internship part-time through the next school year or summer.

What is Cognex?

Cognex is the world's leading producer of machine vision systems and bar code scanners for the industrial automation and logistics markets. We make high speed cameras with embedded microcontrollers and DSPs that are used to do robot guidance, inspection, measurement, flaw detection and much more in the factory automation world on virtually any product you might purchase at a store, including everything from automotive to medical to food. Cognex also specializes in designing the world's hottest selling machine vision-based 1D and 2D barcode reading devices. These products are purchased by the thousands by huge logistics companies across the world to automate their warehousing. While Cognex makes a really cool high-tech product, it is an equally cool company. We boast a unique "Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast" culture that finds us whitewater rafting, playing disc golf, doing wine and beer tastings and more on company-sponsored "Play Hard" days.

What is the Cognex Milwaukee Engineering Center?

Started in 1998 with less than 9 engineers, Cognex-Milwaukee has become one of Cognex's most important engineering teams, with nearly 40 engineers on site and responsibility for the world's #1 selling machine vision system, In-Sight. The Milwaukee team creates embedded factory networking software, user-interface software for In-Sight's programming tools, and Software Quality Assurance tests for these high-tech products. Our team has a long history with MSOE, boasting numerous former MSOE Computer and Software Engineering alumni on staff. A large majority of these 'Cognoids' started their careers at Cognex as interns! Can you prove you are among the 'best of the best" and earn your way onto our growing staff of high-tech engineers? Check out www.cognex.com to find out more about our products and our rapidly growing company!

Submit your resume and transcripts and let's have a conversation about how you can make a difference on our growing team!

About Cognex Corporation

Cognex is the global leader in vision-based inspection, guidance and identification systems that give machines the power to "see." Our technology helps improve the quality and reduce the cost of billions of products that are manufactured every day.

Cognex Corporation designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a range of products that incorporate sophisticated machine vision technology that gives them the ability to "see." Cognex products include bar code readers, machine vision sensors, and machine vision systems that are used in factories, warehouses, and distribution centers around the world to guide, gauge, inspect, identify, and assure the quality of items during the manufacturing and distribution process.

Cognex is the world's leader in the machine vision industry, having shipped more than 1 million vision-based products, representing over $4 billion in cumulative revenue, since the company's founding in 1981. Headquartered in Natick, Massachusetts, USA, Cognex has regional offices and distributors located throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia.

With over $700 million of cash in the bank and no debt, we are a financially strong international company with a culture that maintains the fast paced, creative environment of a startup. Our employees, proudly called "Cognoids," take their work seriously, but don't take themselves seriously. Our Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast culture recognizes our employees for their innovation, perseverance and hard work in a fun, rewarding, and quirky environment.

Working at Cognex: At Cognex, you'll find a dedicated and talented team of people who enjoy their work and take pride in their accomplishments. Cognex offers a dynamic work environment shaped by our mission and values, and a corporate culture that combines creativity, fun, and humor with a dedication to excellence. If you are looking for a financially strong, global company that is the leader in its industry...but one that maintains the fast-paced, creative environment of a start up...Cognex is the right place for you.

Learn more from actual Cognoids by watching our video or apply directly by visiting: http://www.cognexjobs.com

Additional Job Description

Equal Employment Opportunity

Cognex is an equal opportunity employer. Cognex evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

Software Engineering Intern, Summer 2021

LiveRamp is the leading data connectivity platform for the safe and effective use of data. Our platform powers people-based customer experiences that improve the relevance of marketing and allow consumers to connect with the brands and products they love. We thrive on solving fascinating technical problems and enabling our customers' success-and we're always looking for smart, kind, compassionate people to help us blaze a trail.

Mission: LiveRamp makes it safe and easy for businesses to use data effectively.

Get ready for the best learning experience of your life. You will receive the same orientation training as our full-time engineers, you will be matched with an individual mentor, and you will be committing production code by the end of your first week. In the course of your internship, you will be tasked with one or more mission-critical projects and make meaningful contributions to LiveRamp's success. Also, if our previous interns are any guide, you will have a ton of fun in the process!

Internships are 12 weeks long and will be remote. Should we want to extend you a full time offer after you graduate, we ask that you would be willing to consider this at the end of your internship. We are seeking interns interested in full-stack application development and big data back-end engineering.

You will:

  • Contribute deeply to our real production systems - billions of requests a day, 80+ PBs of data, millions of anonymous people records, and powerful web applications to make it all accessible and intuitive.
  • Learn about the business and engineering practices at LiveRamp.
  • Prove yourself and earn the responsibilities of a full-time engineer.

About you: 

  • Possess strong coding skills that you are ready to turn into industry ready coding skills
  • Background? Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or other STEM degrees
  • Excited to learn new languages and technologies
  • Willing to dive in and learn by doing
  • Ready to work with others to solve hard problems
  • Possess a startup personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive
  • At this time, we are only considering those that will be one year or less from graduation at the start of their internship. 

Benefits:

  • People: work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.
  • Fun: we host fun virtual events for our intern class and entire company.
  • Work/Life Harmony: flexible paid time off and remote work support.
  • Savings: our 401K matching plan helps you plan ahead.
 

More about us:

LiveRamp's mission is to connect data in ways that matter, and doing so starts with our people. We know that inspired teams enlist people from a blend of backgrounds and experiences. And we know that individuals do their best when they not only bring their full selves to work but feel like they truly belong. Connecting LiveRampers to new ideas and one another is one of our guiding principles-one that informs how we hire, train, and grow our global team across eight countries and four continents.

LiveRamp is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer (AA/EOE/W/M/Vet/Disabled) and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training, promotion or other employment of associates or the awarding of subcontracts because of a person's race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, protected veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics or other protected status. Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. California residents: Please see our California Personnel Privacy Policy for more information regarding how we collect, use, and disclose the personal information you provide during the job application process.

To all recruitment agencies: LiveRamp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, LiveRamp employees or any other company location. LiveRamp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Seeking a highly motivated hands-on coder with strong interest in testing Juniper Networks routers and switches. This intern will help develop test automation suites to execute test cases. 

 

The candidate must be able to demonstrate strong proficiency in one or more of the following areas: 

 

  • Programming Skills in Shell Scripts and Python 

  • Networking knowledge in TCP/IP and basic routing protocol 

  • Fluency in Windows, UNIX and Linux operating systems  

 

In addition: 

 

  • The candidate must possess outstanding problem-solving skills.  

  • The candidate must possess excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.  

 

Minimum Qualification: 

 

Candidate must be currently enrolled in a bachelor/master's program (EE, CS, or CE degree preferred) and returning to school following completion of the summer internship. 

 

 

 

Juniper's University Talent Program (UTP) introduces next generation talent to Juniper's workforce and provides talented students with an opportunity to develop professional experience at a world-class technology company. And it's not hard to see why so many accomplished students have been compelled to spend their summers at Juniper! 

 

Here at Juniper,UTP provides a comprehensive program that fosters professional as well as personal growth, thoroughly preparing its interns for the next step in their careers. Juniper internships are project-based, allowing interns to solve important problems, make lasting impacts on their teams, and contribute to the company's overall objectives. They are mentored by some of the most talented and skillful innovators in the industry; they connect with transformative thought leaders who promote disruptive ideas in their field. Interns participate in constructive professional workshops, company-wide community service initiatives, and executive speaker series.They build lasting friendships, expand their network, and connect with colleagues from around the world.  

 

At Juniper Networks, you will not only have opportunities to build real-life, hands-on work experience - you'll also have the chance tolearn from the bestand lay the groundwork for a successful career. 

 

Please note that Juniper's 2021 internship program will be conducted remotely. The location listed reflects the location of the team the intern will join, whereas the intern will work from their residence in the US.

Power the Possibilities
The CDK Global technology team is looking for collaborative innovators who are passionate about making their mark on emerging enterprise software products. We’re building and developing cloud technology for the automotive retail industry
that will change the landscape for automotive dealers, original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and the customers they serve.

Be Part of Something Bigger
Each year, more than three percent of the U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) is attributed to the auto industry, which flows through our customer, the auto dealer. It’s time you joined an evolving marketplace where research and development
investment is measured in the tens of billions. It’s time you were a part of something bigger.

We’re expanding our workforce – engineers, architects, developers and more – onboarding early adopters who can optimize, pivot and keep pace with ever-evolving development roadmaps and applications.

Join Our Team
Growth potential, flexibility and material impact on the success and quality of a next-gen, enterprise software product make CDK an excellent choice for those who thrive in challenging, fast-paced engineering environments.
The possibilities for impact are endless. We have exceptional opportunities to evolve our industry by driving change through new technology.


If you’re ready for high-impact, you’re ready for CDK.

Summary:

CDK Global Product and Technology organization is looking for a Software Engineering Intern, that will be part of our Software product development team. The Software product development team is responsible for developing the features on the inventory product suites, integrating with business workflow. Includes all aspects of SDLC, automation and CI/ CD for quality feature releases. If you are passionate about software development and motivated to learn about some of the bleeding edge software development tools, enjoy analyzing, designing, and implementing software, you will certainly be able to learn, grow and contribute in this space. The internship will provide hands-on technical experience as well as collaborate with other team members, architects and product owners in the early and continuous delivery of high quality software products that delight our customers.

Requirements:

  • Actively enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's Computer Science/Computer Engineering degree program
  • Anticipated graduation date of December 2021 or later
  • Software Development skillsin one or more -React/Redux/Angular, JAVA, PostgreS
  • A great attitude and a drive to learn and innovate
  • The ability to participate in a Summer internship program of 10+ weeks (June start date)

Why a career with CDK Global?

We demand diversity. Our people may be spread across countries, continents and cultures, but we're united by a passion and enthusiasm to drive our business forward. This means no matter where you work you'll feel like part of our global team. Diverse backgrounds, ideas and experiences are the only way to deliver world-class service to our customers. Our differences are our strengths

Your benefits.To help us attract and retain the best, we pay people according to performance, not length of service. We will also help you grow your career, not only through focused investment in learning and development but also by enabling you to explore the exciting opportunities our global market has to offer.

The perfect opportunity awaits. Start your career with CDK Global.

 

CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work.  You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on.   That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well.   All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.

At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

Accelerate Your Career

Drive global technology

 

We’re a global market leader in providing software and digital marketing solutions to the automotive industry. Company Description

Accolade is a personalized health and benefits solution that dramatically improves the experience, outcomes and cost of healthcare for employers, health plans and their members. With a unique blend of compassionate advisors, clinical experts and intelligent technologies, we engage individuals and families in their health, establish trust, and influence their decisions at every stage of care. Accolade connects the widest array of personal health data and programs to present a single point of contact to the most effective health and benefits resources, while coordinating with providers at every step. Accolade consistently achieves 70 and higher Net Promoter Scores, 98% consumer satisfaction ratings, and up to 15% employer cost savings. Accolade has been recognized as one of the nation’s 25 most promising companies by Forbes, a fastest-growing private healthcare company by Inc. 5000, and is consistently rated a Top Workplace across the country. For more information, visit accolade.com.

Job Description

Role overview

The Internship – Data Engineering, reporting to Principle Data Engineer II, is an opportunity to cultivate valuable experience in modern data technologies. In this role you will collaborate directly with technical leads to implement solutions to real business problems and design data platform components that support our data science and data analytics efforts. You’ll also gain mentorship and hands on experience operating Python, Apache Spark, Kubernetes in a cloud environment to implement data solutions at scale.

A day in the life…

  • Implement data pipelines in Python and Apache Spark to validate, transform and extract value from data
  • Collaborate on tooling and process documentation to refine the data platform and streamline data usage
  • Work closely with data architecture to establish best practices and automation to monitors and enhance data quality
  • Support the work of data scientists and data analysts through collaboration, tooling and automation
Qualifications

  • Proficiency using Python and SQL to interact with data, experience with Apache Spark is a plus
  • Comfortable on the linux command line, infrastructure and/or dev-ops experience is a plus
  • Familiarity with cloud platform technologies (AWS and/or GCP)
  • Experience with other data technologies is valuable (e.g. Elasticsearch, MongoDB, Hadoop and friends, any of the various SQL flavors)
  • A first principles mindset, we value observation over assumption and innovation over convention
  • Willingness to be in over your head, the data engineering space evolves rapidly and we’re always learning
  • A strong team mentality, our core responsibility is to support and act as a force multiplier for our data consumers


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Software Engineering Intern

  

Job Description:

   

At Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), we don't just believe in the power of technology, we believe in the power of people when technology works for them. We believe in applying new thinking and ideas to improve the way our customers live and work.

Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You'll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a "reverse mentoring" program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is seeking a highly motivated Software Engineering Intern (Servers). This is a unique internship for current Purdue students as it is full-time over the summer working for Hewlett Packard Enterprise remotely in the US and continues part-time (10-20 hours a week) during the school year on Purdue's campus (West Lafayette, IN) while you continue your degree.

The position may work with our High Performance Computing (HPC), Volume Compute, or Cyber Security groups as part of the team participating in production level projects including automation of tests, analyzing & resolving technical issues, writing new code or revising current code for HPE programs, communicating with internal HPE and 3rd party teams.

Education and Experience Required:

  • Computer Engineering or Computer Science majors at Purdue University
  • Desire to learn new skills and highly motivated.
  • Very organized and ability to communicate effectively with others.
  • Python coding experience.
  • Strong writing skills and ability to document work.
  • GPA above 3.0

Hewlett Packard Enterprise Values:

Partnership first: We believe in the power of collaboration - building long term relationships with our customers, our partners and each other

Bias for action: We never sit still - we take advantage of every opportunity

Innovators at heart: We are driven to innovate - creating both practical and breakthrough advancements

HPE is an EOE / Female / Minority / Individual with Disabilities / Protected Veteran Status

What do we offer?

Extensive social benefits, flexible working hours, a competitive salary and shared values, make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the worlds most attractive employers. At HPE our goal is to provide equal opportunities, work-life balance, and constantly evolving career opportunities.

If you are looking for challenges in a pleasant and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers

You can also find us on:

https://www.facebook.com/HPECareers

https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers

Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to be based out of Seattle, who thrives on designing, coding, and maintaining high performance data processing applications on the JVM platform (primarily in Clojure and Scala), running on AWS. 

Your ideal internship should be one where you work in a small team and are empowered to make yourself and your team more productive on a daily basis. You should want to be part of a team where your desire to grow and learn are valued and aptly rewarded; where using and contributing to open source are looked upon as an asset; where innovating and executing are core to your teams' beliefs.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will:

  • Write performant code and write automated test to validate correctness of code
  • Develop and deploy large-scale microservices and/or data processing systems
  • Meet development milestones and business requirements on schedule
  • Independently analyze, propose and develop solutions for technical problems and issues
  • Ensure the adherence to the standards and procedures that result in an environment compliant with information security policy

Our ideal Software Engineering Intern will have:

  • A willingness to learn new languages and techniques to solve challenging problems.
  • Experience in functional programming fundamentals.
  • BS degree in Computer Science, related degree or equivalent. Graduating before August 2022. 
  • Ability to write clean code that works, is readable, maintainable and follows best practices and coding standards
  • Understanding of OO and functional design, languages, algorithms and data structures
  • A philosophy of iteration and continuous improvement
  • A desire to own design and architecture end to end

Unwavering in our pursuit of standardizing global identity data, we are approachable, real people that genuinely care about the success of those we partner with. With a commitment to service, innovation, and ownership, Ekata is a dynamic place to work for folks who want to make an impact on a global scale. We provide learning & development opportunities for each employee and promote work-life flexibility through self-managed time off. Headquartered in downtown Seattle, Ekata is growing internationally with offices in Budapest, Hungary, Amsterdam, and in Singapore.

To learn more about the experience of working at Ekata visit: https://ekata.com/careers/

Ekata prides itself on celebrating diversity, inclusivity, and being an equal-opportunity employer.

#LI-TD

Job Details:

Job Description: 

The Developer Software Engineering Team at Intel, is looking for a low-level, platform software developer to help us enable and performance optimize matrix operations for our hardware products. The selected intern will design programming languages for machine learning applications. The candidate will contribute to the development of a DPC++ language interface across vector and tensor machines.

Qualifications:

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school-work/ classes/ research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Enrolled in MS in Computer Science or PhD. in Computer Science or Mathematics or Software Engineering related discipline.

6+ months of experience with the following skills:

  • Modern C++ software development including debugging and advanced features such as templates
  • Programming in OpenCL, CUDA, or SYCL
  • Knowledge of LLVM compiler infrastructure and passes
  • Knowledge of fundamental machine learning kernels and concepts
  • Experience with Python programming or similar scripting language for test scripting

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with Linux
  • Strong understanding of computer system architecture and operating systems
  • Experience with parallel programming interfaces and communication runtimes
  • Familiarity with contemporary parallel programming models, e.g. MPI, PGAS
  • Familiarity with GPU
  • Familiarity with DPC++ and Level0

          

Job Type:Student / Intern

Shift:Shift 1 (United States of America)

Primary Location: US, Texas, Austin

Additional Locations:Virtual US and Canada

Business group:Intel Architecture, Graphics, and Software (IAGS) brings Intel's technical strategy to life. We have embraced the new reality of competing at a product and solution level-not just a transistor one. We take pride in reshaping the status quo and thinking exponentially to achieve what's never been done before. We've also built a culture of continuous learning and persistent leadership that provides opportunities to practice until perfection and filter ambitious ideas into execution.

SmartNews is a leading mobile app of news aggregation services. We analyze millions of articles to deliver the most engaging information with high quality, in near-real-time fashion, to millions of users around the world.

The marketing technology team is looking for a talented software engineering intern to help us build systems and features that can acquire more users.


Responsibilities

  • Take ownership of a challenging problem, build and ship the system under strong mentorship
  • Write high-quality code and ship solid features.
  • Document and present what you did to SmartNews leadership.

Requirements

  • Majored in computer sciences or related subjects. Preferred Junior and above students. A graduate student is a plus.
  • Strong communication skills and learning ability.
  • Proficient in one or two modern programming languages, preferred Python3, Swift, Kotlin Go, or Java.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and algorithmic thinking.
  • Familiar with data analytics, SQL, and relational databases. Sensitive to numbers and charts.
  • Passionate about building systems, solving challenging problems.
  • Previous internship experience in Ads technology is a plus, but not required.
  • Be familiar with modern development tools, e.g. git, k8s, docker, is a plus.

Work closely with, learn from, and assist softwareengineers in the development of various engineering assignments related to state-of-the-art products by executing SW design, coding, and documentation tasks, and assist in the testing of software within finished products, systems or subsystems. This is a paid internship opportunity.

  • Carry out basic SW engineering tasks that will help in understanding SW development procedures and product development while learning new SW engineering skills.

  • Must have good interpersonal skills and have the ability to build a good network

  • Learn, support, communicate, reinforce, and defend the mission, values and culture of the organization.
  • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
  • Enrolled in a 4 year Software or Electrical Engineering program.
  • At least 2 years of college completed with 3.0 GPA or better.
  • Experience with Linux and Python preferred.
  • Strong communication and organizational skills.
  • Ability to solve complex problems using your natural curiosity.
  • Work effectively as a member of a team or on individual tasks.

LexisNexis Risk Solutions is seeking interns to be part of Geospatial intelligence based product development in Cloud helping customers asses the risk of home insurance.

Must have:
  • Pursuing BS Computer Science or equivalent education
  • Passionate about data
  • Good problem-solving skills
  • Desire and ability to learn new processes and technologies
  • Good oral and written communication skills


Technical Skills:

1) At least One programming language experience required. Preferably Java.

2) Cloud based development experience required. Preferably AWS.

3) Knowledge of APIs, Docker, K8s, and Containerization.

  • Programming languages: Java Spring Boot, Spring Cloud Data flow.

5) Strong research skills. Good oral and written communications skills.

2) Build new or enhance insights dashboards.

3) Create end to end process flow documents.

4) Participate in all Agile-Scrum ceremonies like daily stand-up, sprint kick off, demos, retrospective and squad health checks.
